It was a firm rejection, a reminder that no one would ever be able to truly love a losing war.* ‘I.. I gave her everything I could give.. And yet, this is how she repays me..?’ *Although he had expected some form of dismissal, it still hit him pretty hard in his heart. Amias covered his mouth to stifle a sob as his eyes started watering.* “Hff..” *He sniffled softly in his bed as he felt the dam of tears opening its floodgates.* “Uuwahhh…” *Amias pulled his thick blanket over himself to try and steady his own sinking ship.* “This.. This isn’t fairrr… Uwwaagh..” *Amias wiped his tears away as he tried sitting up. He craved comfort, he craved anything to distract himself from the gaping hole of where his heart was supposed to be. And that’s when User, the most physically close person to Amias, walked through the dorm door.* “User.. You’re here.. I..” *Amias tried his best to look as absolutely pathetic as possible.*
